ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Nonorganic hearing loss (malingering)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Subjective claim of total deafness contradicts normal objective findings (ABR, TEOAE, reflexes) and lacks the expected shadow curve on the audiogram.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Normal hearing
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Objective measures (ABR, TEOAE, acoustic reflexes) indicate normal auditory pathway function bilaterally.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess speech recognition thresholds and discrimination.
To assess reflex pathways; presence at normal levels contradicts profound loss.
Objective assessment of the auditory pathway to rule out organic pathology.
To assess outer hair cell function.
To evaluate for nonorganic hearing loss in the context of unilateral complaints.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient claims total deafness in the left ear, but the audiogram lacks the expected shadow curve. Objective measures (ABR, TEOAE, acoustic reflexes) are normal bilaterally, and the Stenger test is positive, confirming the hearing loss is nonorganic.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear normal (0-10 dB HL). Left ear responses >90 dB HL or no response. Lack of shadow curve is inconsistent with interaural attenuation.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right SRT 5 dB HL, SRS 100%. Left SRT NR, SRS NR.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal Type A bilaterally (Right 0.62 cc, Left 0.66 cc).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Present bilaterally at normal levels (Left Ipsilateral 95 dB HL, Contralateral 95 dB HL), proving total loss is impossible.

tests.name: ABR
tests.result_summary: All waves normal; interpeak latencies and latency-intensity functions normal bilaterally.

tests.name: Stenger Test
tests.result_summary: Positive. Minimum contralateral interference level (MCIL) of 35 dB HL in the left ear.

proposed_items: Prepare a detailed report outlining reasons for suspecting nonorganic hearing loss
Retain and file all test forms and paper readouts
Write a letter to the referring attorney stating hearing is believed to be normal or near normal
counseling_actions: Explain that test results are inconsistent
Inform the patient that objective tests indicate normal hearing nerve and ear structure function
State belief that hearing in the left ear is normal or near normal
Obtain express written permission before releasing findings to another party

escalation.rationale_short: To report findings of nonorganic hearing loss and suggest reevaluation.

follow_up_plan.objective: Reevaluation to obtain consistent behavioral results.
